intro: Picris hieracioides subsp. hieracioides, commonly known as common groundsel, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant has basal and alternate leaves that are lanceolate to ovate, with serrated margins and a hairy surface. Its bright yellow flowers are arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the central disk florets. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
